abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the Efficient Industrial
            Boilers Project for China were the following: the outcome
            was satisfactory, the sustainability was likely, the
            institutional development impact was substantial, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both satisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that this project resulted in a
            generally satisfactory conclusion, despite numerous
            difficulties due to its complicated structure involving many
            beneficiaries, an inefficient technology procurement
            process, and a number of changes in the Government
            supervising entity and Bank task management. A key reason
            for the success achieved was the steady dedication to the
            project's goals by the implementing agency,
            participating boiler manufacturers, and Bank team. At
            project appraisal, all nine of the boiler manufacturers were
            state-owned enterprises completly owned by their supervising
            government authorities, and the Ministry of Machinery
            Industry was charged with responsibility for the direction
            and development of the industry. The project design
            reflected this situation, aiming to achieve maximum
            efficiency gains in each of the main product lines. By
            adopting practical approaches, the implementing agency,
            boiler manufacturers and Bank team were able to adapt to
            many of these changes.

5084074.trustfund:
TF028484-GEF1 CHINA EFFICIENT INDUSTRIAL
            BOILERS PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the Efficient
            Industrial Boilers Project is to reduce Greenhouse Gas
            Emissions (GHG), as well as emissions of total suspended
            particulates, sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides through: a)
            the development of affordable energy efficient and cleaner
            industrial boilers (IB) designs; b) the mass production and
            marketing of the improved boiler models; and c) the broad
            dissemination of more energy efficient and clearer IB
            technologies. The project will be composed of the following
            components: a) upgrading of existing Chinese boiler models;
            b) adoption of new high efficiency boiler models; c)
            technical assistance and training for boiler producers and
            consumers; and d) monitoring, evaluation and project management.
